channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Provost: Purdue will not provide numbers on students affected by visa revocations
Shark filmed swimming among children before ‘deadly’ attack
A century ago, the government hired unemployed young men to build America's forests, trails, and parks. Photos show FDR's 'tree army.'

Pope Francis' funeral to be held Saturday
US, global economic outlook worsens in the face of Trump's tariffs, IMF says
item.description: The outlook for the U.S. and global economies this year and next has significantly worsened in the wake of President Donald Trump’s tariffs and the un...

item.title: Many tourists reportedly killed in attack in Indian-controlled Kashmir
item.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi says the gunmen behind a terrorist attack on tourists in the Kashmir region "will not be spared!"

item.title: Who will be the next pope? Here are some possible contenders
item.description: Pope Francis' death on Monday started off a series of traditions that culminates in a vote for his successor. Here are some of the possible candidates...

item.title: Mar 18: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: Israel launches deadly new strikes over Gaza; Astronauts head back to Earth after nine months in space.

item.title: Trump admin live updates: Trump to give commencement speeches at Alabama, West Point
item.description: Democratic lawmakers are advocating for the release of Kilmar Abrego Garcia and other detainees.

item.title: Some GOP states are targeting driver’s licenses issued to immigrants illegally in the US
Watch Live: Karen Read's second trial starts with opening statements
item.description: Watch live as Karen Read's second trial starts today with opening statements in the Massachusetts murder case.

item.title: IMF forecasts slower growth for U.S. economy in 2025, citing trade war
item.description: The U.S. economy will grow 1.8% this year, the IMF said in its World Economic Outlook, down .9% from January

item.title: Top NY prosecutor steps aside, clears way for Trump's nominee to take over
item.description: The top federal prosecutor in Manhattan has agreed to step aside, clearing the way for President Donald Trump to install his nominee.

item.title: LIVE: ABC News Live
item.description: 24/7 coverage of breaking news and live events

item.title: Anti-Defamation League says anger at Israel is now the driving force behind antisemitism in the US
item.description: The Anti-Defamation League says the number of antisemitic incidents in the United States reached a record high last year.

item.title: Drones pose increasing risk to airliners near major US airports
